author: Staff Reporter
text:
With products of Co-optex reaching wider customers through 200 sales centres across the country, it is hopeful of achieving the target of Rs. 325 crore for the current fiscal, said T.N. Venkatesh, Managing Director, Co-optex.

Around two lakh people were involved in handloom weaving in Tamil Nadu. The products were marketed through the 130 showrooms in the State and 70 showrooms in other States. With new designs, Co-optex achieved a new milestone by achieving a sales target of Rs. 306 crore last year.

“This year we have already achieved Rs. 285 crore,” he added.

He said that 2,200 designs in cotton products were introduced for the summer season and products worth Rs. 5.55 crore had been procured. About 50 summer cotton exhibitions would be conducted across the country to market the products till June 16, he added. He said that 65 per cent of the total sales in Co-optex account for cotton materials. Rasipuram silk saris were gaining in popularity. Showrooms in Salem, Namakkal, and Karur would be modernised soon.

Earlier, the ‘Buy two, get one free’ sale was inaugurated at the Co-optex showroom in Namakkal by District Collector V. Dakshinamoorthy, Mr. Venkatesh, and K.P.P. Baskar, MLA.

They distributed gold coins to six persons who were winners of ‘Thanga Mazhai Thittam.’
title: Co-optex all set to meet sales target
